clinical_study.brief_title: Prehabilitation in Patients With Esophageal or Gastric Cancers
clinical_study.official_title: Prehabilitation in Patients With Esophageal or Gastric Cancers

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives: The primary objective of this study is to assess the feasibility of a internet-based preoperative exercise program in patients with esophageal or gastric cancers. Secondary objectives are to evaluate the effects of this preoperative program on functional capacity, anxiety and depression, quality of life, fatigue and markers of inflammation.
Methods: This feasibility study will be conduct at University Hospital Saint-Luc in Brussels. Twenty patients with esophageal or gastric cancers will participate in internet-based program 3 sessions per week. Each session will combine aerobic and resistance training. Moreover, inspiratory muscle strengthening (IMT) will be performed daily. The researcher will conduct weekly telephone calls to educate and motivate subjects. Assessments will be performed at baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (if a neoadjuvant treatment is indicated), one day before surgery, 10 days after hospital stay and 3 months after surgery. The following parameters will be measured: functional capacity, quality of life, fatigue, anxiety and depression and markers of inflammation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At study completion (3 months after surgery)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants lost to follow-up

primary_outcome.time_frame: At study completion (3 months after surgery)
primary_outcome.description: (Number of completed sessions/Number of planned sessions) x 100

primary_outcome.time_frame: At study completion (3 months after surgery)
primary_outcome.description: Program satisfaction will be evaluated by a questionnaire including items about internet program

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients who experienced one or more adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: At study completion (3 months after surgery)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be evaluated by listing adverse events that occur (e.g. fall, injury or exercise-related symptom)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (week 5), one day before surgery, 10 days after surgery and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Functional capacity will be assessed by 6-minute walk test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life for esophageal cancer patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (week 5), one day before surgery, 10 days after surgery and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life using the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-E questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life for gastric cancer patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (week 5), one day before surgery, 10 days after surgery and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life using the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Ga questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (week 5), one day before surgery, 10 days after surgery and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue using the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Fatigue questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (week 5), one day before surgery, 10 days after surgery and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety and depression using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS). Scores for each subscale (depression and anxiety) are summed-up and range from 0 to 21. Values from 0-7 indicate normal levels, 8-10 are border values, and values from 11-21 are considered to be pathological

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (week 5), one day before surgery, 10 days after surgery and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Neutrophil lymphocyte ratio will be measured via a blood test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (week 5), one day before surgery, 10 days after surgery and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein will be measured via a blood test

arm_group.description: Subjects will carry out a preoperative internet-based program including aerobic and resistance training three sessions per week

intervention.description: Subjects will performed an internet-based exercise program before surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of esophageal cancer or gastric cancer requiring surgery
- More than 18 years
- Able to read, write and understand French or English
- Time before surgery > 2 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Surgical emergency
- Cognitive or neuropsychiatric diseases
- Neuromuscular or orthopedic disorders limiting exercises
- Cardiopulmonary disease contraindicating exercises
